clean: GRAPH FIX G3: Filter out _reverse edges to restore directionality. Without this filter, A->B and B->A_reverse make the graph undirected, causing impact analysis to report that changing a utility impacts controllers AND that changing controllers impacts the utility (false positive).
raw:
# GRAPH FIX G3: Filter out _reverse edges to restore directionality.
# Without this filter, A->B and B->A_reverse make the graph undirected,
# causing impact analysis to report that changing a utility impacts controllers
# AND that changing controllers impacts the utility (false positive).

clean: GRAPH FIX G2: Return None instead of "complex_expression" "complex_expression" caused intra-function collisions when multiple complex args in same call got identical node IDs. Better no edge than false edge.

# GRAPH FIX G2: Return None instead of "complex_expression"
# "complex_expression" caused intra-function collisions when multiple

clean: GRAPH FIX G4: Removed explicit BEGIN TRANSACTION. Python sqlite3 manages transactions automatically (isolation_level default). Explicit BEGIN causes OperationalError when nested.
raw:
# GRAPH FIX G4: Removed explicit BEGIN TRANSACTION.
# Python sqlite3 manages transactions automatically (isolation_level default).
# Explicit BEGIN causes OperationalError when nested.

clean: GRAPH FIX G9: Delete orphaned incoming edges before deleting nodes. When file A is re-indexed, we must delete: 1. Nodes from file A 2. Edges FROM file A (outgoing) 3. Edges TO nodes in file A from OTHER files (incoming) Without #3, we get dangling edges pointing to deleted nodes.
raw:
# GRAPH FIX G9: Delete orphaned incoming edges before deleting nodes.
# When file A is re-indexed, we must delete:
# 1. Nodes from file A
# 2. Edges FROM file A (outgoing)
# 3. Edges TO nodes in file A from OTHER files (incoming)
# Without #3, we get dangling edges pointing to deleted nodes.

clean: GRAPH FIX G15: Handle custom managers (Django) Scenario: User.active_users.all() -> candidate = "User.active_users.all" The first token before "." should be the model name This catches: User.custom_manager.filter(), Order.pending.count(), etc.
raw:
# GRAPH FIX G15: Handle custom managers (Django)
# Scenario: User.active_users.all() -> candidate = "User.active_users.all"
# The first token before "." should be the model name
# This catches: User.custom_manager.filter(), Order.pending.count(), etc.

clean: GRAPH FIX G5: Chunk queries to avoid SQLite 999 variable limit. Large codebases with 250+ models would exceed limit and crash.

# GRAPH FIX G5: Chunk queries to avoid SQLite 999 variable limit.
# Large codebases with 250+ models would exceed limit and crash.

clean: FIX #17: Handle TypeScript path aliases like "@controllers/auth" -> "controllers/auth" TypeScript projects use tsconfig.json paths to alias directories: "@controllers/*" -> "src/controllers/*" By stripping the leading "@", we align the alias with the physical path. Example: "@controllers/account" -> "controllers/account" "backend/src/controllers/account" ends with "controllers/account" -> MATCH
raw:
# FIX #17: Handle TypeScript path aliases like "@controllers/auth" -> "controllers/auth"
# TypeScript projects use tsconfig.json paths to alias directories:
#   "@controllers/*" -> "src/controllers/*"
# By stripping the leading "@", we align the alias with the physical path.
# Example: "@controllers/account" -> "controllers/account"
#          "backend/src/controllers/account" ends with "controllers/account" -> MATCH

clean: 5. Suffix Check with Boundary Enforcement "src/guards/auth" (was auth.guard.ts) ends with "guards/auth" -> MATCH "src/interceptors/auth" (was auth.interceptor.ts) ends with "guards/auth" -> NO MATCH
raw:
# 5. Suffix Check with Boundary Enforcement
# "src/guards/auth" (was auth.guard.ts) ends with "guards/auth" -> MATCH
# "src/interceptors/auth" (was auth.interceptor.ts) ends with "guards/auth" -> NO MATCH

clean: GRAPH FIX G14: Handle implicit index resolution (Node/TypeScript convention) Import: './models' -> cleans to 'models' Symbol: 'src/models/index.ts' -> cleans to 'src/models/index'

# GRAPH FIX G14: Handle implicit index resolution (Node/TypeScript convention)
# Import: './models' -> cleans to 'models'
# Symbol: 'src/models/index.ts' -> cleans to 'src/models/index'

clean: Without this fix, the suffix check fails because 'src/models/index' doesn't end with 'models'

clean: === CRITICAL ARCHITECTURE FIX: FILES MUST EXIST FIRST === We must flush 'files' and 'config_files' before processing any complex logic (CFG, Python parent tables) because those tables have FK to 'files'. Without this, FK violations occur because children reference non-existent parents.
raw:
# === CRITICAL ARCHITECTURE FIX: FILES MUST EXIST FIRST ===
# We must flush 'files' and 'config_files' before processing any complex
# logic (CFG, Python parent tables) because those tables have FK to 'files'.
# Without this, FK violations occur because children reference non-existent parents.

clean: SEMANTIC FIX: Forward analysis proves REACHABILITY, not VULNERABILITY. FlowResolver finds paths from sources to sinks. If no sanitizer is detected, the path is REACHABLE (a candidate for exploitation), not a confirmed exploit. Only IFDS (backward analysis) can confirm actual VULNERABILITY.
raw:
# SEMANTIC FIX: Forward analysis proves REACHABILITY, not VULNERABILITY.
# FlowResolver finds paths from sources to sinks. If no sanitizer is detected,
# the path is REACHABLE (a candidate for exploitation), not a confirmed exploit.
# Only IFDS (backward analysis) can confirm actual VULNERABILITY.

clean: NOTE: "read_line" removed - too generic, matches any buffered reader
raw: # NOTE: "read_line" removed - too generic, matches any buffered reader

clean: NOTE: Generic "execute" removed - too broad (matches Command::execute, Task::execute, etc.)
raw: # NOTE: Generic "execute" removed - too broad (matches Command::execute, Task::execute, etc.)

clean: Tool importance for sorting (lower = more important)
raw: # Tool importance for sorting (lower = more important)

clean: Note: <level> tag uses loguru's default colors (INFO=white, ERROR=red, etc.)
raw: # Note: <level> tag uses loguru's default colors (INFO=white, ERROR=red, etc.)
